cyclone.name: HENRI
cyclone.current_location: about 190 mi (310 km) southwest of Bermuda
cyclone.trajectory: Henri is expected to continue moving west for another day, then turn north on Friday and curve north-northwest toward southern New England late in the weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern New England coast (Long Island/RI vicinity)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: East-coast shoreline from the Outer Banks of North Carolina northward to New England and Atlantic Canada will feel increased surf, rip currents, and possible fringe tropical-storm conditions.
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤5%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; most likely outcome is breezy conditions with gusts below 39 mph late Saturday night through Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected along the Delaware River near Wilmington.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of light to moderate rain possible Sunday, generally ≤1 inch.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and higher surf along Delaware beaches beginning late week.
